text: Are you building the environment from scratch, or copying someone else's? If the later, just make sure you do `conda activate envname` before you install anything, and only install things with `conda install pkgname`

text:
I've mostly learned it by trial and error. The key thing is to keep the conda-installed programs higher up your `$PATH` than anything else. When you do `conda activate myenv` , it's mostly just doing `export PATH=/path/to/miniconda/envs/myenv/bin:$PATH`

I actually really dislike how conda highjacks my terminal prompt, so I will often just do that manually
